intro: Chassalia lurida, commonly known as the pale chassalia, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of pale blue to purple flowers that bloom in late summer. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wetlands or along stream banks. Chassalia lurida is a herbaceous perennial that plays a role in supporting local pollinators.
